required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of ALKS 5461 for the Treatment of Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) - the FORWARD-4 Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3 Efficacy and Safety Study of ALKS 5461 for the Adjunctive Treatment of Major Depressive Disorder (the FORWARD-4 Study)

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of ALKS 5461.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 5 in the Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 5 weeks for each stage
primary_outcome.description: The MADRS-10 scale is a clinician-administered questionnaire comprised of 10 items used to measure the severity of MDD symptoms. Scores range from 0 (no apparent symptoms) to 60 (most severe symptoms). Individual questionnaire items include: Apparent Sadness, Reported Sadness, Inner Tension, Reduced Sleep, Reduced Appetite, Concentration Difficulties, Lassitude, Inability to Feel, Pessimistic Thoughts, and Suicidal Thoughts.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients Who Exhibited Treatment Response (MADRS-10)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 5 weeks for each stage
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects demonstrating MADRS-10 treatment response, defined as a >/= 50% reduction in MADRS-10 score from baseline to the end of the efficacy period (Week 5). The MADRS-10 scale is a measure of the severity of MDD symptoms and includes the following 10 items: Apparent Sadness, Reported Sadness, Inner Tension, Reduced Sleep, Reduced Appetite, Concentration Difficulties, Lassitude, Inability to Feel, Pessimistic Thoughts, and Suicidal Thoughts. Scores range from 0 (no apparent symptoms) to 60 (most severe symptoms).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 5 weeks for each stage
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects achieving remission, defined as a MADRS-10 score of </= 10 at the end of the efficacy period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 weeks for Stage 1 and 6 weeks for Stage 2

intervention.description: Sublingual tablet, taken once daily (in addition to open-label treatment with a commercially available antidepressant)
Sublingual tablet, taken once daily (in addition to open-label treatment with a commercially available antidepressant)
Sublingual tablet, taken once daily (in addition to open-label treatment with a commercially available antidepressant)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a Body Mass Index (BMI) of 18.0 to 40.0 kg/m2, inclusive
- Agree to use an acceptable method of contraception for the duration of the study
- Have a Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) primary diagnosis
- Have no more than 2 inadequate responses to antidepressant therapy (ADT) in the current Major Depressive Episode (MDE)
- Additional criteria may apply
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have a current primary Axis-I disorder other than MDD
- Have used opioid agonists (eg, codeine, oxycodone, tramadol, morphine) or opioid antagonists (eg, naloxone, naltrexone) within 14 days
- Have received electroconvulsive therapy treatment within the last 2 years or received more than one course of electroconvulsive treatment during lifetime
- Have attempted suicide within the past 2 years
- Have a positive test for drugs of abuse
- Are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding
- Have a history of intolerance, allergy, or hypersensitivity to buprenorphine or opioid antagonists (eg, naltrexone, naloxone)
- Have had a significant blood loss or blood donation within 60 days
- Additional criteria may apply

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were diagnosed with major depressive disorder (MDD) and had an inadequate response to 1 or 2 adequate courses of treatment with a commercially available antidepressant therapy (ADT) during the current major depressive episode (MDE). All subjects continued ADT for the duration of the study.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This was a Sequential Parallel Comparison Design (SPCD) study comprised of 2 stages. In Stage 1 subjects were randomized to ALKS 5461 or placebo (2:2:9). In Stage 2 only placebo non-responders from Stage 1 were re-randomized to ALKS 5461 or placebo (1:1:1). One subject randomized to the PBO group in Stage 1 did not receive study drug.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Psychiatrist decision to try new tx

baseline.population: All subjects randomized to Stage 1 (i.e., all subjects randomized during the study) who received ≥ 1 dose of study drug.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 5 in the Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
outcome.description: The MADRS-10 scale is a clinician-administered questionnaire comprised of 10 items used to measure the severity of MDD symptoms. Scores range from 0 (no apparent symptoms) to 60 (most severe symptoms). Individual questionnaire items include: Apparent Sadness, Reported Sadness, Inner Tension, Reduced Sleep, Reduced Appetite, Concentration Difficulties, Lassitude, Inability to Feel, Pessimistic Thoughts, and Suicidal Thoughts.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 5 weeks for each stage
outcome.population: Stage 1 and Stage 2 Full Analysis Sets (FAS) consisted of subjects who were randomized and took at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 postbaseline MADRS-10 assessment in the respective stage.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Week 5 in the Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
measure.description: The MADRS-10 scale is a clinician-administered questionnaire comprised of 10 items used to measure the severity of MDD symptoms. Scores range from 0 (no apparent symptoms) to 60 (most severe symptoms). Individual questionnaire items include: Apparent Sadness, Reported Sadness, Inner Tension, Reduced Sleep, Reduced Appetite, Concentration Difficulties, Lassitude, Inability to Feel, Pessimistic Thoughts, and Suicidal Thoughts.
measure.population: Stage 1 and Stage 2 Full Analysis Sets (FAS) consisted of subjects who were randomized and took at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 postbaseline MADRS-10 assessment in the respective stage.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis was conducted for each stage separately and overall efficacy was based on combined stage analysis where stage-specific estimates were combined using pre-specified equal weights. Within each stage ALKS 5461 2mg/2mg was compared to placebo (i.e., ALKS 5461 2mg/2mg S1 vs Placebo S1; and ALKS 5461 2mg/2mg S2 vs Placebo S2. The pre-specified order of hypothesis tests was ALKS 5461 2/2 compared to placebo followed by ALKS 5461 0.5mg/0.5mg compared to placebo.
analysis.p_value_desc: Hypothesis tests were two-sided with an alpha of 0.05. Control of type 1 error inflation due to multiplicity was achieved by pre-specifying a fixed sequence for statistical tests.
analysis.method_desc: ALKS 5461 was compared to pbo using stage-specific MMRM for MADRS-10 Change from Baseline. Model-derived estimates were combined using equal weights.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis was conducted for each stage separately and overall efficacy was based on combined stage analysis where stage-specific estimates were combined using pre-specified equal weights. Within each stage ALKS 5461 0.5mg/0.5mg was compared to placebo (i.e., ALKS 5461 0.5mg/0.5mg S1 vs Placebo S1; and ALKS 5461 0.5mg/0.5mg S2 vs Placebo S2). The pre-specified order of hypothesis tests was ALKS 5461 2/2 compared to placebo followed by ALKS 5461 0.5/0.5 compared to placebo.
analysis.p_value_desc: Hypothesis tests were two-sided with an alpha of 0.05. Control of type 1 error inflation due to multiplicity was achieved by pre-specifying a fixed sequence for statistical tests.
analysis.method_desc: ALKS 5461 was compared to pbo using stage-specific MMRM for MADRS-10 Change from Baseline. Model-derived estimates were combined using equal weights.

outcome.title: Proportion of Patients Who Exhibited Treatment Response (MADRS-10)
outcome.description: The proportion of subjects demonstrating MADRS-10 treatment response, defined as a >/= 50% reduction in MADRS-10 score from baseline to the end of the efficacy period (Week 5). The MADRS-10 scale is a measure of the severity of MDD symptoms and includes the following 10 items: Apparent Sadness, Reported Sadness, Inner Tension, Reduced Sleep, Reduced Appetite, Concentration Difficulties, Lassitude, Inability to Feel, Pessimistic Thoughts, and Suicidal Thoughts. Scores range from 0 (no apparent symptoms) to 60 (most severe symptoms).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 5 weeks for each stage
outcome.population: Stage 1 Full Analysis Set (FAS) consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 postbaseline assessment of MADRS in Stage 1. Stage 2 FAS consisted of Stage 1 placebo non-responders who entered Stage 2 and who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 postbaseline assessment of MADRS in Stage 2.

measure.title: Proportion of Patients Who Exhibited Treatment Response (MADRS-10)
measure.description: The proportion of subjects demonstrating MADRS-10 treatment response, defined as a >/= 50% reduction in MADRS-10 score from baseline to the end of the efficacy period (Week 5). The MADRS-10 scale is a measure of the severity of MDD symptoms and includes the following 10 items: Apparent Sadness, Reported Sadness, Inner Tension, Reduced Sleep, Reduced Appetite, Concentration Difficulties, Lassitude, Inability to Feel, Pessimistic Thoughts, and Suicidal Thoughts. Scores range from 0 (no apparent symptoms) to 60 (most severe symptoms).
measure.population: Stage 1 Full Analysis Set (FAS) consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 postbaseline assessment of MADRS in Stage 1. Stage 2 FAS consisted of Stage 1 placebo non-responders who entered Stage 2 and who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 postbaseline assessment of MADRS in Stage 2.

outcome.title: Remission Rate
outcome.description: The proportion of subjects achieving remission, defined as a MADRS-10 score of </= 10 at the end of the efficacy period.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 5 weeks for each stage
outcome.population: Stage 1 Full Analysis Set (FAS) consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 postbaseline assessment of MADRS in Stage 1. Stage 2 FAS consisted of Stage 1 placebo non-responders who entered Stage 2 and who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 postbaseline assessment of MADRS in Stage 2.

measure.title: Remission Rate
measure.description: The proportion of subjects achieving remission, defined as a MADRS-10 score of </= 10 at the end of the efficacy period.
measure.population: Stage 1 Full Analysis Set (FAS) consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 postbaseline assessment of MADRS in Stage 1. Stage 2 FAS consisted of Stage 1 placebo non-responders who entered Stage 2 and who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 postbaseline assessment of MADRS in Stage 2.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.time_frame: 5 weeks for Stage 1 and 6 weeks for Stage 2
outcome.population: Safety population consists of all randomized subjects who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.population: Safety population consists of all randomized subjects who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

reported_events.time_frame: 5 weeks for Stage 1 and 6 weeks for Stage 2
reported_events.desc: Safety population consists of all randomized subjects who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Should an Investigator desire to disclose study results, Sponsor will review the results disclosure prior to public release and can embargo the disclosure for a period of at least 60 days. Revisions to the disclosure will be negotiated in good faith. For a multicenter study the Investigators agree to publish/publicly present the results together with the other sites for the 12 month period after study results are available unless Sponsor grants written permission in advance.
